pt: {sc}ascribe{/sc} {sc}attribute{/sc} {sc}assign{/sc} {sc}impute{/sc} {sc}credit{/sc} mean to lay something to the account of a person or thing. {sc}ascribe{/sc} suggests an inferring or conjecturing of cause, quality, authorship.
{sc}attribute{/sc} suggests less tentativeness than {sc}ascribe{/sc}, less definiteness than {sc}assign{/sc}.

pt.t: {it}attributed{/it} to Rembrandt but possibly done by an associate

pt: {sc}assign{/sc} implies ascribing with certainty or after deliberation.

pt.t: {it}assigned{/it} the bones to the Cretaceous period

pt: {sc}impute{/sc} suggests ascribing something that brings discredit by way of accusation or blame.

pt.t: tried to {it}impute{/it} sinister motives to my actions

pt: {sc}credit{/sc} implies ascribing a thing or especially an action to a person or other thing as its agent, source, or explanation.
